result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:13 AM (21CF349/22CF121/22CF56) Defendant Thomas M Brewer in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Thomas M Brewer.  Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews plea agreement. Victim rights compliance has been met. As to case 21CF349, def pleads guilty. As to case 21CF415 Ct 1, def pleads guilty. As to case 22CF121 Ct 1, def pleads guilty. Court reviews charges and penalties. Court discusses 22CF121 being assigned to Branch 2; def wishes to resolve case in Branch 1. Court makes findings. As to case 21CF349, case 21CF415 Ct 1, court accepts plea and finds def guilty. Case 22CF121 Ct 1 court accepts plea, finds def guilty and approves Drug Treatment Court; Case 21CF415 counts 2 and 3 DRI; Case 22CF121 counts 2 and 3 DRI. Arguments given; def makes statement. 

Court imposes the following sentence;
21CF349
-WPS 2 years:
-1 year IC 
-1 year ES
-imposed and stayed
- probation for 3 years with the following conditions;
- $6,610.80 restitution payment to the victim
- Compliance with all drug treatment court requirements 
- successful completion of drug treatment court 
- DNA + costs
- Costs
21CF415 Ct 1
- 84 days DCJ w/ 63 days credit (time served)
-  DNA + costs
- Costs
22CF121 Ct 1
- Def agrees to terms of treatment court deferred sentencing agreement.
Sentencing adjourned until completion of termination of drug court treatment
- Costs
22CF121 court amends bond to $2,000 personal appearance bond w/ same non-monetary conditions.

Post-judgment hearing on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:27 AM - 21CF415 & 22CF121 - Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas M Brewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Thomas M Brewer. Preliminary Waiver filed. Court reviews and accepts waiver; binds over to Br 1. Court proceeds to Arraignment. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $50 by next court date. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

1:01 PM - 21CF415 & 22CF121 - Prosecuting attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas M Brewer in court, in custody.  Attorney Teri Strohschein (eligible) in court for Thomas M Brewer. Discussion on missed Initial Appearances. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $2000 Cash bond with conditions: The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $50 by next court date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
